intro: Urostigma saussureanum, commonly known as the Himalayan false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a perennial herb with a basal rosette of leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant has a fibrous root system and is adapted to cold, mountainous environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes at elevations ranging from 2,500 to 5,000 meters. Its botanical features make it an important part of the ecological balance in its native habitat.
